sentences.sentence: An Israeli strike on Gaza kills a top Islamic jihad commander as violence between the two sides continues to escalate.

sentences.sentence: Belgian MEP Mark Tarabella speaks following his release from jail over the European Parliament corruption scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Greek political leaders go head-to-head on the first televised election debate in eight years, before the country goes to the polls on May 21st.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Sixteen acts will battle it out in Eurovision's second semifinal on Thursday, with Austria, Australia and Slovenia likely to qualify.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The group Palestinian Islamic Jihad has confirmed an Israeli airstrike on an apartment block in the Gaza Strip on Thursday morning killed one of its top members and two colleagues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Israeli military said Ali Ghali was the chief of Jihad's rocket squad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The latest violence comes a day after Israeli strikes on Gaza killed three top Islamic Jihad militants and 12 others, including four children, according to Palestinian officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On Wednesday, Israel's Ayin Dome air defense system intercepted hundreds of rockets launched from the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Israeli army and militants are continuing to trade heavy cross-border fire amid the worst escalation of violence to hit the region in months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Although most of the rockets from Gaza are intercepted, a number got through, causing significant damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The office of UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres voiced deep concern over the violence and warned Israel it must adhere to international law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He also condemned the indiscriminate launching of rockets from Gaza into Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Egypt, a frequent mediator between the sides, reportedly brokered a ceasefire, but truce efforts appear to falter as fighting intensified late on Wednesday. Je vois mon visage à la une du JT. Tous les soirs, mon nom est partout. Le nom que porte ma famille, ma maman, ma femme, ma soeur, ma fille, mon fils, qui daughter, my son, they never deserved that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In tears, as this Belgian MEP describes his life since he was accused of being involved in the corruption scandal that has rocked the European Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Marc Tarabella is awaiting trial, but the Belgian authorities decided to release him from his obligation to be under electronic surveillance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a status he's taken advantage of to explain his version of events, from the unexpected search at his home to his days in jail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

We were all disappointed one day by a friend who lied to you. According to the Belgian MEP's lawyer, Tarabella will have to respond to any police checks, not leave Belgium without prior agreement and avoid contacting the other people charged in the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis has admitted the recent wiretapping scandal involving Pegasus spyware and an opposition leader was wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: His comments came amid a televised debate ahead of the first round of national elections on May 21st. Neighbours Turkey are also preparing to go to the polls and Mitsotakis insists he is ready to speak to whoever is elected.

sentences.sentence: We will respect the crisis of the Turkish people and of course, since the Greek people have been trusted, I am willing to speak with anyone who chooses the Turkish people. Είμαι δεδομένος να συνομιλήσω όπως το έκανα μέχρι σήμερα με οποιονδήποτε επιλέξει ο τουρκικός λαός.

sentences.sentence: One of the largest modern and contemporary art museums in the world, Paris' Pompidou Centre is to close for five years for renovations from 2025.

sentences.sentence: Its groundbreaking inside-out structure that displays pipework on the outside has suffered serious wear and tear.

sentences.sentence: It's the building's first major upgrade and will cost €262 million to update its structure for fire safety, disability access and general repairs.

sentences.sentence: Thousands mourning the recent death of Brazilian singer Rita Lee joined a wake inside Sao Paulo's planetarium, a venue the 75-year-old wrote about in her memoirs and often visited.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Having sold over 55 million records worldwide, Lee left a lasting mark with her irreverence, creativity and compositions containing messages that helped introduce Brazilian society to feminism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

It tries to present the picture not as it would be beneficial to the authorities, but as the picture is liked by the citizens themselves." According to experts Euronews spoke to, it's possible many Russians don't fall for the state propaganda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They simply fear to express their position because they're scared of repercussions and persecution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But it's not only fear that's preventing Russian citizens speaking out, it's also disappointment and apathy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Deep disillusionment with the Soviet regime, as well as the so-called democracy in the 1990s, has shaped Russians' apoliticism, especially as many think the war doesn't affect them.
